How Taskflow Works

Start with tasks. Structure emerges.

1. Create Tasks

Start with what needs to get done. Tasks are work items, deliverables, or goals.

2. Assign to Roles

Every task belongs to a role. Roles represent functions - not specific people.

3. Tag People (Optional)

Attach real people to roles. One person can fill many roles; one role can have many people.

4. Structure Emerges

As you add tasks and roles, your organization's shape reveals itself. Use Cards, Tree, or Org Chart views to explore.

The insight: Traditional org charts start with structure. Taskflow starts with work, and structure follows naturally.

Pattern Detected

These tasks look like a repeating pattern. Would you like to make this a workflow?

Link Tasks

Soft Link (Sequence Only)
Tasks are related but dates are independent. "B happens after A" without date coupling.
Hard Link (Dates Coupled)
If one task's date changes, linked tasks adjust automatically.
